easy.title: Control Game Gets Better on PS5 Pro with New Update
easy.summary: The game Control just got a big update that makes it look and play much better on the PS5 Pro console. This update adds special features that use the PS5 Pro's power to make the game run smoother and look more beautiful. You can now choose to unlock the frame rate completely, which means the game can run as fast as your TV allows. There are also improvements to how characters' hair and plants look, plus better reflections and shadows. The update lets you turn special features on or off depending on what you prefer. Because of these improvements, the writer plans to play Control again during the Christmas holidays to earn all the trophies once more. The game now takes full advantage of the PS5 Pro's special abilities to provide an amazing gaming experience.

easy.background_reading: Control is an action-adventure game developed by Remedy Entertainment. In the game, you play as Jesse Faden, who becomes the director of a secret government agency called the Federal Bureau of Control. The game takes place in a mysterious building called the Oldest House, where reality doesn't always follow normal rules. Players use special psychic powers and weapons to fight enemies and solve puzzles. The game is known for its strange story, cool supernatural powers, and unique visual style. It was first released in 2019 and has won many awards for its creative design and engaging gameplay.

mid.title: Control's Latest Update Optimizes Game Performance Specifically for PS5 Pro Hardware
mid.summary: Control Ultimate Edition's recent 1.30 patch represents a significant optimization specifically targeting the PS5 Pro's enhanced capabilities. The update introduces comprehensive graphical improvements that leverage the console's advanced hardware, including complete frame rate unlocking that removes previous limitations in both Quality and Performance modes. This is complemented by native support for Variable Refresh Rate (VRR) and 120Hz displays, ensuring buttery-smooth gameplay regardless of visual settings chosen. The patch fully implements PlayStation Spectral Super Resolution (PSSR), Sony's AI-powered upscaling technology that delivers noticeably improved edge smoothing and enhanced detail in hair and vegetation rendering. Crucially, Remedy has maintained user choice by making PSSR optional, with clear communication about potential performance trade-offs. Additional enhancements include upgraded reflection quality, improved texture and shadow resolution specifically for PS5 Pro, and refinements to SDR, HDR, and Temporal Anti-Aliasing implementations. While Xbox Series X and S also receive improvements, the PS5 Pro version stands out as the definitive way to experience Control, with the author confirming plans to replay the game during the upcoming holiday season to re-earn the Platinum trophy, citing the substantial visual and performance upgrades as justification for another playthrough.

mid.background_reading: Control represents Remedy Entertainment's evolution of their signature narrative-driven action gameplay, building upon foundations established in earlier titles like Max Payne and Alan Wake. The game employs the Northlight Engine, Remedy's proprietary technology designed specifically for creating immersive, physics-based environments with advanced lighting and destruction systems. Control's development focused heavily on creating the 'Oldest House' as a character itself - a shifting, brutalist architecture environment that constantly reconfigures itself. The game's metaphysical themes explore concepts of reality alteration, consciousness, and bureaucratic surrealism within a secret government agency setting. Originally released in 2019, Control Ultimate Edition compiled all post-launch content including The Foundation and AWE expansions, the latter serving as a direct bridge to Remedy's connected universe that also includes Alan Wake. The PS5 Pro represents Sony's premium console tier focused on delivering enhanced graphical fidelity through increased computational power, improved ray tracing capabilities, and AI-powered upscaling technology.

hard.title: Control Ultimate Edition's 1.30 Patch Delivers Comprehensive PS5 Pro Optimization Through Advanced Graphical Enhancements and Performance Unlocking
hard.title_zh: 《控制终极版》1.30补丁通过先进图形增强和性能解锁实现全面PS5 Pro优化
hard.summary: The 1.30 patch for Control Ultimate Edition represents a sophisticated technical achievement in console game optimization, specifically engineered to harness the PS5 Pro's advanced hardware architecture. This comprehensive update introduces a multi-layered approach to graphical enhancement, beginning with the complete removal of frame rate limitations across both Quality and Performance modes—a significant departure from previous console implementations where such modes typically enforced specific performance targets. The integration of native Variable Refresh Rate (VRR) and 120Hz display support further complements this frame rate freedom, creating a fluid gaming experience that dynamically adapts to rendering demands without visual artifacts. Central to the update's visual improvements is the full implementation of PlayStation Spectral Super Resolution (PSSR), Sony's machine learning-based upscaling technology that employs temporal accumulation and neural network processing to deliver superior image reconstruction. This manifests particularly in enhanced edge detection and smoothing, along with improved rendering of complex alpha effects like hair and foliage. The optional nature of PSSR implementation demonstrates thoughtful design philosophy, allowing users to balance visual fidelity against potential performance impacts based on their specific display capabilities and personal preferences. Additional PS5 Pro-specific enhancements include substantially upgraded reflection systems, increased texture resolution that better utilizes the console's expanded memory bandwidth, and refined shadow mapping techniques that reduce artifacts while maintaining performance. The update also incorporates improvements to Standard Dynamic Range (SDR) and High Dynamic Range (HDR) implementations, alongside refined Temporal Anti-Aliasing (TAA) that works in concert with PSSR to minimize shimmering and temporal instability. While the patch notes indicate corresponding improvements for Xbox Series X and S platforms, the PS5 Pro version emerges as the definitive technical showcase, leveraging the console's unique feature set to deliver what the author characterizes as the ideal conditions for revisiting the game's surreal environments and kinetic combat systems during the upcoming holiday period.
hard.zh_hard:
《控制终极版》的1.30补丁代表了主机游戏优化领域的一项精密技术成就，专门针对PS5 Pro的先进硬件架构进行了深度定制。此次全面更新采用了多层级的图形增强方法，首先彻底取消了质量和性能模式下的帧率限制——这与以往主机版本中特定性能目标被强制执行的惯例形成了显著区别。原生可变刷新率（VRR）和120Hz显示支持的集成进一步补充了这种帧率自由，创造了能够动态适应渲染需求而不会产生视觉伪影的流畅游戏体验。

更新的视觉改进核心在于全面实施了PlayStation光谱超级分辨率（PSSR），这是索尼基于机器学习的升级技术，采用时间累积和神经网络处理来提供卓越的图像重建。这特别体现在增强的边缘检测和平滑处理，以及改进的复杂alpha效果（如头发和植被）渲染上。PSSR实施的可选性展示了深思熟虑的设计理念，允许用户根据其特定显示能力和个人偏好来平衡视觉保真度与潜在性能影响。

额外的PS5 Pro专属增强包括大幅升级的反射系统、提高的纹理分辨率（更好地利用主机扩展的内存带宽）以及精炼的阴影映射技术（在保持性能的同时减少伪影）。更新还包含了对标准动态范围（SDR）和高动态范围（HDR）实施的改进，以及与PSSR协同工作以最小化闪烁和时间不稳定性的精炼时间抗锯齿（TAA）。

虽然补丁说明显示Xbox Series X和S平台也有相应改进，但PS5 Pro版本作为明确的技术展示脱颖而出，利用了主机的独特功能集来提供被作者描述为在即将到来的假期期间重新探索游戏超现实环境和动态战斗系统的理想条件。此次优化不仅证明了Remedy对技术细节的关注，也展示了成熟游戏如何通过适当的后期支持在新硬件上获得新生，为游戏保存和体验增强设立了新的行业标准。

hard.background_reading: Control Ultimate Edition's technical foundation rests upon Remedy Entertainment's proprietary Northlight Engine, architected specifically for creating dynamic, physics-driven environments with advanced destruction systems and real-time global illumination. The engine's rendering pipeline employs a deferred rendering approach combined with compute shader-based lighting calculations, enabling complex material interactions and volumetric effects. The PS5 Pro represents Sony's premium console tier featuring a substantially upgraded GPU architecture with increased compute units, enhanced ray tracing acceleration hardware, and dedicated machine learning processors for AI-based upscaling. The console's memory subsystem has been expanded with faster GDDR6 memory and improved bandwidth allocation for graphics processing. Control's original technical achievement included pioneering use of physics-based rendering (PBR) materials, real-time destruction systems, and advanced particle effects that pushed previous-generation hardware limits. The 1.30 patch represents a comprehensive re-engineering of these systems to leverage the PS5 Pro's specific architectural advantages, including its machine learning capabilities for PSSR implementation, enhanced memory hierarchy for texture streaming, and improved compute performance for complex shader operations.
